1.content:
Tom sprawled out onto his bed after a long day of moving. He had just moved all his things into his apartment room after driving a moving truck for 3 hours straight. He needed three things: a shower, some sleep, and Maria. He missed those nights they would have in the campus dorms during orientation in the summer. They were in the same student group, and instantly hit it off. Before he knew it, they were doing the no-pants-dance in his dorm room. He sighed, oh how he missed those nights. His body odor then hit his nostril, and then he realized how much more he missed smelling good. He hopped up, dug through one of the boxes he brought in for some shorts and a towel, and got into the shower.

In the shower, he thought about all the possibilities that awaited him now that he was all on his own. He didn't have to worry about coming in too late and waking his aunt up after his late-night escapades. He could do whatever he wanted, when he wanted, to whomever he wanted now. Mid-way through the shower, two things crossed his mind: (1) he never really specified to Maria what their relationship was, and (2) he didn't bring any shampoo for his hair. Both were equally problematic for Tom, but the Maria situation had him a bit worried. He was about to enter this new part of his life by himself, and he wanted to keep it that way. He couldn't have a relationship hold him down, especially since there were so many ladies that he had not yet met.

As soon as Tom got out of the shower and dried off, he got his phone and texted Maria.

Tom: Hey

a few minutes passed, and his phone screen lit up.

Maria: Hey there stranger!

"Oh man", Tom thought to himself, "She's already using nicknames".

Tom: So I actually wanted to talk to u about something kinda important

Maria: Yeah, whats up?

Tom gulped. He sort of felt bad for breaking this news to Maria. He wasn't too sure on how she was going to react.

Tom: I just wanted to talk about us and this thing that we had going on

Maria: lol what about it dude

Tom: well I was just hoping that we could both just start off our college lives fresh and free of any relationships

Maria: did u think we were in a relationship lol

Tom: No, but I just wanted to clear the air between us lol

Maria: dude it's whatever lol idc

Tom: ok lol, I'll see you around

Tom threw his phone onto his bed and pumped his fist in victory. That couldn't have gone any better! Maria didn't even seem upset! He sighed in relief, and closed his eyes. He was glad that dilemma was over, but he still had one problem. His hair was still a bit greasy from moving into his apartment all morning, and he didn't want to look like a bum during his first day of classes tomorrow. He looked outside his window, and the sun would soon be going down.


"Fuck", he muttered to himself, "Do I stay in bed, or venture out and get some shampoo?"

"I'll just wear a hat" Tom said to himself. He bundled himself up the best he could with the lone pillow and single blanket that he had. His entire room lacked quantity but it did have the essentials for the most part, so he couldn't complain.

Tom begun to drift into sleep, when he heard a faint voice call out "tommyboy!"

His eyes shot open, and looked around the room. He knew that was home alone. "Probably somebody from downstairs just foolin around or something" Tom muttered to himself. He then drifted back into sleep.

"tommyboy!" The voice cried out, "tommyboyyyyyyy!"

Tom opened his eyes again. He was not in his room. He was seated at a desk in in an all white room. He looked around frantically, and then came to the realizations that he was in a dream. "or maybe even a nightmare" Tom said to himself.

In front of the desk was a large red fancy chair that super villains would usually turn around in, typically with a cat on their lab. He laughed at the idea of that, when he heard the voice again, although it was much closer and clearer than before.

"Tommyboy?"

Tom swallowed all the saliva in his mouth. The voice was coming from behind the chair.

Tom spoke up, "Uh yes. I am Tom. Sometimes known was Thomas, or Thomas depending on where your from. Maybe even Tomothan if you're creative and didn't like the name Johnathon. But Tommyboy is a nickname that is known by a select few including me,myself, and I"

"Tommyboy, you never fail to make me smile", the voice said, "I wish you would've gone into show business instead of wasting your time with school{/font}"

"Well disembodied voice, you need an education to get a real job these days, and plus my Aunt Des is sorta making me do this whole college thing"

The chair spun around.


Tom's jaw dropped.

Sitting there was a mirror image of himself, except this guy was smiling instead of having his mouth to the floor

" Tommyboy, you are so much more than what you put out to be. You are capable of so many fantastic feats!"

Tom sat there, dumbfounded. "Am I high?" he asked,"I knew that gas station hot dog was a terrible idea".

"No Tommyboy, you are asleep. In your own mind. You are in my domain" the doppelganger responded.

"Well buddy, you could use a bit more color in here. Kinda too bland for my own taste. This place is giving me real mental hospital vibes man", Tom said to the man across from him. "what are you supposed to be anyways?".

I am your subconscious, Tommyboy. I have been in your brain, dormant for all of these years. Watching, and waiting for my opportunity to arise. And now, it seems like my time to come into fruition is here.
"
Tom was taken aback by what his subconscious had to say. He had heard of finding his inner self, but this was ridiculous.

"So why are you coming to me now, oh mighty subconscious?" Tom said jokingly, "Are you here to show me the errors of my ways?"

"On the contrary. I am here to enlighten you my dear boy. Let you know of your capabilities." the subconscious stated.

"such as?" Tom questioned, with his face full of doubt. He knew that he was in a dream, but something about this dream felt a bit off. a bit too real. He disregarded that feeling, and reassured himself that this was a dream.

"You hold the same power as I do in this dreamworld, but in reality. When we become become one being, you will witness the power that you deserve. Life will become a dream for us." the subconscious said, passionately.

Tom was now convinced that he was having a fever dream. He needed to wake up quick because the other him was starting to creep him out a little bit. He pinched himself to wake himself up, but was only met with pain. "Ah shit man, what the hell" Tom muttered to himself.

"This world is real Tom." the subconscious laughed, "and I'm going to make all your dreams real"

The subconscious then reached over the table and placed his hand on Tom's forehead. Tom was frozen with fear at this point. It felt like a cold hand was actually on his forehead, was squeezing down.

"WHEN WE WAKE UP", the subconscious exclaimed, "REALITY WILL BE OUR DREAM"

There was a bright flash of white light, and then Tom woke up.

He was covered in sweated, and he looked around his room to see if he was out of his dream. It was pouring outside. He grabbed his phone and checked the time.

4:50 a.m.

He only had 3 hours and 10 minutes until his first college class started.

"Fuck", he grumbled to himself, "and it's gonna be raining on the first day? I hope it stops soon"

Tom closed his eyes and went back to bed. What he didn't notice, however, was right as he said that, the rain stopped completely.

Tom sat up stared at the carpet. He needed to practice, and he had no idea if he would be putting other people in danger if he practiced on them. He had to start somewhere.

"My apartment has hardwood floors," he said. He blinked, and when he opened his eyes, the grey carpet was replaced with lacquered oak. "I have a pizza here." He removed a slice and took a bite. Not bad for no toppings. He placed the slice back in the box. "This box is in the fridge." The box vanished.

Tom nodded, not bothering to get up and check the refrigerator. Well, he managed to get three things in a row at least partially right. He figured he was ready for the big leagues again.

"Hey, neighbor!" she said, "Figured I'd drop by and see what was going on in the new place. I heard they put down hardwood floors in here!" She glanced downwards. "Swanky!"

"Yeah, I guess it is," said Tom. "You wanna come in."

Tom paused for a moment and tried to think of a good half truth. "Well, I tried out that new sushi place with a friend, but didn't really have the best time of it."

Jojo shook her head. "I thought she got bored of that after the last time."

Tom heard a knock at the door and stood bolt upright. He wasn't expecting anyone. Des wasn't supposed to be here yet, and he wasn't expecting company or a delivery. He crept over to the door, trying to silence any creeping thoughts he had about Suki showing up with a bottle of chloroform and a syringe of mind-control serum. He looked through the peephole. A plain brown package sat in front of his door. This seemed like a trap, but on the other hand, the package was addressed to him.

"This package is inside my apartment," he whispered. It vanished, and Tom nodded. He closed the door behind him and locked it. The whine vanished. He turned back towards the couch. The package was resting on it. "And that package is not a trap."

The world hung silent. Tom couldn't feel any change going on. He walked over to the couch and unwrapped the package. A featureless cardboard box was inside the brown wrapping paper. It smelled...old. Older than most cardboard boxes should be. Hell, older than cardboard, probably. He turned his face away from the package and opened it, not knowing what he expected to see. He looked back.

In the box was a hardcover, fairly new-looking book. It had gold writing on the front cover. Tom reached in and pulled it out of the box.

"The Dreamer's Birthright," he read, "A guide for a beginning reality warper who just fucked up majorly for the first time and needs to know how and why his actions resulted in him leaving his new friend with a pair of boobs bigger than her own body, then abandoning her to the whims of of a titty-witch." It didn't explain how or why he had this power, but it still came with a list of explanations of dos and do-nots ("Do try using your power to make your home life easier" vs "Don't try to use your power to gain additional control over your power. It sounds good, but it won't work"), warnings ("YOU CAN STILL DIE IF YOU FUCK UP TOO HARD"), and overall pro-tips ("Teleportation is easier than driving, because you have less chance for your mind to wander").

Tom came to the end of the first chapter. An afterwards was written in larger red font.

"You doubtlessly feel a bit guilty about what happened back at the restaurant. Don't. You have to fall before you learn to walk. Or something like that. There's no easy way out of this: you need to practice your power, and you need to do it smartly. Here are a list of places to go, people to practice on, and topics to try out."

Tom glanced at the phrase "supernatural power." That would probably be where he'd need to start, right? What Suki did to Aly wasn't physically possible, let alone normal. Hell, he didn't even intend for it to happen. Getting control over that end of things would probably be the best place to start. He decided to give that section a check first; as soon as he did, the page of the book flipped en masse to reveal the chapter.

The text glowed with a faint green light. Tom began to read.

"Chapter 7: On Giving Others Magic Powers:

Before we begin, remember the importance of 'Training Mode' discussed in chapter 2. If you do not remember what Training Mode is, or if you have skipped chapter 2 due to some unresolved guilt issues regarding a friend who is currently chugging magic milk like it was cheap soda, I can summarize. In training mode, any interactions you make with this book will be regarded as totally normal. You could read this book aloud at a funeral and then make gentle love to it afterwards if you so desired (please don't do that, however, as the pages would get sticky). Speaking to invoke your power will not attract attention. Moreover, training mode gives you an increased ability to reverse unwanted changes by setting up a 'temporal checkpoint'. By sincerely regretting the change you made, you will be able to return to the point at which you activated Training Mode. To do so, simply say the words 'Training Mode is active."

Tom did so.

"Excellent," continued the text. "Let's continue. To begin, the act of trusting another with supernatural powers is extremely risky, for reasons I hope even you would be smart enough to understand. To mitigate these risks, there are three rules you should obey.

1. You should not, and in fact cannot, give another person powers akin to yours.
2. You should only give powers you can easily mitigate to people you can trust.
3. Do not make your gifts retroactive. Preface your statements with phrases like 'starting now'. Someone having a history of being superhuman tends to lead to unwanted consequences.

To ensure that you understand these rules, you will undergo a minor exercise. Summon your Aunt Des to this apartment and give her a power that you think would be appropriate for her."

The book was blank after that point. Tom took a deep breath. He had training wheels, at the very least, and practicing on a woman he trusted seemed like the best possible option.

"Aunt Des is about to knock on the door."

Knock knock.

Tom walked over to the door, opened it, and tried to look surprised.

"College boy!" said Aunt Des, jogging excitedly in place. Tom tried to ignore his aunt's bouncing tits with limited success. His subsequent effort to ignore them when she hugged him was even more of a failure. "Sorry for the surprise visit, I just had to see the new place!"

"It's alright," said Tom, trying to seem innocuous, "Come on in!"

Des stepped into the apartment, giving it a critical-but-approving look. "Not bad, not bad." She turned to Tom. "You alright? You seem a bit...off, for some reason."

Tom averted his gaze and tried to think of a good excuse. "Oh, you know. Just...moving anxieties, I guess. Kinda sucks not having you around."

Des' smile was as sweet and genuine as saccharine. "Aw, Tom," she began. "That's so sweet! And such bullshit. I watched over you during puberty, young man. I know when you're up to something." She narrowed her eyes and gave Tom a mastermind's grin.

Tom knew that the sooner he tried out his power, the sooner that Des would stop being suspicious. Tom mused on his options and was struck with a sudden concern. The old saying about absolute power corrupting absolutely was ringing in his head. He'd be a fool to not try it, of course, but starting off by experimenting on himself seemed like the closest thing to an ethical option he had.
